query: Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor specifications operational pressure range sensitivity sentinel -9999.0 hPa

search_result: The operational pressure range of the Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor is not explicitly mentioned in the provided context. However, it is important to note that the PTB110 does not require regular maintenance and has no replaceable parts, which suggests it is designed for durable use. Its sensitivity is not detailed either, but if malfunctioning, it should be replaced. The mention of ‘-9999.0 hPa’ likely indicates a placeholder for pressure readings outside of the operational limits.

The operational pressure range of the Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor is not explicitly mentioned in the provided context. However, it is important to note that the PTB110 does not require regular maintenance and has no replaceable parts, which suggests it is designed for durable use. attributes.text:
PTB110 Maintenance
PTB110 does not require regular maintenance.
The sensor has no replaceable parts. If the sensor malfunctions, replace it.

ADJUSTMENT AND CALIBRATION
Calibration of the PTB110 series barometers is NIST traceable
and the barometers are supplied with a NIST traceable
calibration certificate.
There are two push buttons available for the offset fine
adjustment inside the barometer (see the figure on the previous
page). The adjustment step is 0.05 hPa.
OPERATING THE BUTTONS
Restoring Adjustments
To restore the adjustments, press and hold down the left button
while switching on the barometer. After releasing the button, a
green LED starts flashing.
When the factory adjustments are in use, the green LED flashes
twice. When the user adjustments are in use, the green LED
flashes three times.
Now you can change the factory adjustments to user adjustments
or vice versa by pressing the left button.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Using Analog Output Test Mode
To activate the test mode, press and hold down the right button
while switching on the barometer.
The function forces the voltage or frequency output to 50% of
the scale. As an indication of the test mode, the red LED is lit.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Offset Correction
To activate the offset correction mode, press and hold down both
buttons switching on the barometer.
The green and red LEDs are lit. Now you can adjust the offset
correction upwards or downwards.
 Each time when pressing the left button, the offset
goes down by one step (5 Pa), and the green LED
flashes once.
 Each time when pressing the right button, the offset
goes up by one step (5 Pa), and the red LED flashes
once.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.


BaroVue Maintenance

Troubleshooting
Symptom: Pressure and temperature values are returned as NAN.
l Check that the sensor card is inserted fully in its socket and in the correct orientation (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Verify that the white wire is connected to the terminal specified by the
SDI12Recorder() instruction.
l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.
Open the main case by unclipping the latch and opening the main door. See Figure 8-1 (p.
21).
l Sensor card plugs into the silver card socket mounted on the motherboard (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Correct sensor-card orientation is with card notch facing down (towards the
motherboard). The card revision number should be visible.
CAUTION:
the slot.
If the sensor card is oriented incorrectly, it will not insert fully. Do not force the card into
To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring
tension pushes the sensor card out of the socket.
NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell
Scientific for recalibration or general servicing.
Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching
the package before touching the element.
Carefully align and insert the sensor card in the card socket on the motherboard.
Confirm the correct orientation and gently push the sensor card into the socket until it
clicks into place.
Before closing the main case, double-check that the card is inserted in the correct
orientation. Refer to Figure 8-1 (p. 21).
Close the main case and secure it by pressing down on the latch and clipping it into
position

query: Vaisala PTB110 pressure sensor communication failure -9999.0 hPa troubleshooting

search_result: The communication failure of the Vaisala PTB110 pressure sensor showing -9999.0 hPa could indicate invalid data. This might stem from various issues, but it is notably not caused by a missing sensor or require sensor adjustment. To troubleshoot, check the sensor's connections, and verify that it is correctly configured and operational.

The communication failure of the Vaisala PTB110 pressure sensor showing -9999.0 hPa could indicate invalid data. This might stem from various issues, but it is notably not caused by a missing sensor or require sensor adjustment. To troubleshoot, check the sensor's connections, and verify that it is correctly configured and operational.

attributes.description: Refers to data that is erroneous or unusable in its current form, usually represented by codes or values like -999, NaN, -80°C.
attributes.name: invalid data

attributes.name: missing sensor

attributes.name: sensor adjustment

search_result: To troubleshoot the Vaisala PTB110 pressure sensor communication failure indicated by -9999.0 hPa, first ensure that the sensor is operating within the correct humidity conditions and pressure range specified for the device. Check the connections and power supply to the sensor, as well as any potential environmental factors affecting its operation.

attributes.text:
PTB110 Maintenance
PTB110 does not require regular maintenance.
The sensor has no replaceable parts. If the sensor malfunctions, replace it.

ADJUSTMENT AND CALIBRATION
Calibration of the PTB110 series barometers is NIST traceable
and the barometers are supplied with a NIST traceable
calibration certificate.
There are two push buttons available for the offset fine
adjustment inside the barometer (see the figure on the previous
page). The adjustment step is 0.05 hPa.
OPERATING THE BUTTONS
Restoring Adjustments
To restore the adjustments, press and hold down the left button
while switching on the barometer. After releasing the button, a
green LED starts flashing.
When the factory adjustments are in use, the green LED flashes
twice. When the user adjustments are in use, the green LED
flashes three times.
Now you can change the factory adjustments to user adjustments
or vice versa by pressing the left button.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Using Analog Output Test Mode
To activate the test mode, press and hold down the right button
while switching on the barometer.
The function forces the voltage or frequency output to 50% of
the scale. As an indication of the test mode, the red LED is lit.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Offset Correction
To activate the offset correction mode, press and hold down both
buttons switching on the barometer.
The green and red LEDs are lit. Now you can adjust the offset
correction upwards or downwards.
 Each time when pressing the left button, the offset
goes down by one step (5 Pa), and the green LED
flashes once.
 Each time when pressing the right button, the offset
goes up by one step (5 Pa), and the red LED flashes
once.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.


BaroVue Maintenance

Troubleshooting
Symptom: Pressure and temperature values are returned as NAN.
l Check that the sensor card is inserted fully in its socket and in the correct orientation (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Verify that the white wire is connected to the terminal specified by the
SDI12Recorder() instruction.
l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.
Open the main case by unclipping the latch and opening the main door. See Figure 8-1 (p.
21).
l Sensor card plugs into the silver card socket mounted on the motherboard (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Correct sensor-card orientation is with card notch facing down (towards the
motherboard). The card revision number should be visible.
CAUTION:
the slot.
If the sensor card is oriented incorrectly, it will not insert fully. Do not force the card into
To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring
tension pushes the sensor card out of the socket.
NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell
Scientific for recalibration or general servicing.
Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching
the package before touching the element.
Carefully align and insert the sensor card in the card socket on the motherboard.
Confirm the correct orientation and gently push the sensor card into the socket until it
clicks into place.
Before closing the main case, double-check that the card is inserted in the correct
orientation. Refer to Figure 8-1 (p. 21).
Close the main case and secure it by pressing down on the latch and clipping it into
position

query: troubleshooting and maintenance information for Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor invalid sentinel value -9999.0 hPa maintenance guide

search_result:
For the Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor showing an invalid value of -9999.0 hPa, follow these troubleshooting and maintenance steps:

1. **Check Connections:** Ensure the sensor card is fully inserted in its socket and in the correct orientation. Verify all wiring connections, ensuring the red wire connects to a 12V terminal and the black wire to the ground terminal.

2. **Voltage Check:** Use a digital voltage meter to confirm the voltage supplied to the sensor. If using a switched terminal, temporarily connect it to a non-switched 12V terminal for testing.

3. **Calibration:** Since the PTB110 does not require regular maintenance or have replaceable parts, if the issue persists, consider recalibrating the device. The calibration certificate provided is NIST traceable.

4. **Factory Settings:** If adjustments have been made, restore factory settings by holding the left button while powering on the unit. A flashing green LED indicates success.

5. **Replace Sensor:** If all above fails, the sensor may need replacement. Contact the supplier for a new calibrated sensor card.

For the Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor showing an invalid value of -9999.0 hPa, follow these troubleshooting and maintenance steps:

1. **Check Connections:** Ensure the sensor card is fully inserted in its socket and in the correct orientation. Verify all wiring connections, ensuring the red wire connects to a 12V terminal and the black wire to the ground terminal.

2. **Voltage Check:** Use a digital voltage meter to confirm the voltage supplied to the sensor. If using a switched terminal, temporarily connect it to a non-switched 12V terminal for testing.

3. **Calibration:** Since the PTB110 does not require regular maintenance or have replaceable parts, if the issue persists, consider recalibrating the device. The calibration certificate provided is NIST traceable.

4. **Factory Settings:** If adjustments have been made, restore factory settings by holding the left button while powering on the unit. A flashing green LED indicates success.

5. **Replace Sensor:** If all above fails, the sensor may need replacement. Contact the supplier for a new calibrated sensor card.

query: Vaisala PTB110 communication failure sentinel -9999 hPa causes wiring power firmware maintenance steps

search_result: The communication failure in the Vaisala PTB110, indicated by the sentinel value of -9999 hPa, suggests the presence of invalid data. This issue is not caused by a missing sensor or sensor adjustments, implying that the problem may lie elsewhere, potentially in the wiring or firmware affecting power and maintenance operations.

attributes.description: Refers to data that is erroneous or unusable in its current form, usually represented by codes or values like -999, NaN, -80°C.
attributes.name: invalid data

attributes.description: Refers to a sensor that is physically missing from the data collection setup.
attributes.name: missing sensor

attributes.description: The process of fine-tuning the settings of a sensor to ensure accurate measurements.
attributes.name: sensor adjustment

search_result:
The communication failure sentinel -9999 hPa in the Vaisala PTB110 may indicate issues with power, wiring, or firmware. Suggested maintenance steps include:
1. Check and ensure proper power supply to the device.
2. Inspect wiring connections for any damage or disconnections.
3. Update or reload the firmware to fix potential software bugs affecting communication.

2. Inspect wiring connections for any damage or disconnections.
3. Update or reload the firmware to fix potential software bugs affecting communication.

query: Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor specifications normal operating pressure range measurement resolution sensitivity limits

search_result:
The Vaisala PTB110 atmospheric pressure sensor has the following specifications:
- Normal operating pressure range: Not specified in the provided context.
- Measurement resolution: Adjustable offset step of 0.05 hPa (5 Pa correction).
- Sensitivity limits: Not explicitly mentioned in the context.

attributes.text:
PTB110 Maintenance
PTB110 does not require regular maintenance.
The sensor has no replaceable parts. If the sensor malfunctions, replace it.

ADJUSTMENT AND CALIBRATION
Calibration of the PTB110 series barometers is NIST traceable
and the barometers are supplied with a NIST traceable
calibration certificate.
There are two push buttons available for the offset fine
adjustment inside the barometer (see the figure on the previous
page). The adjustment step is 0.05 hPa.
OPERATING THE BUTTONS
Restoring Adjustments
To restore the adjustments, press and hold down the left button
while switching on the barometer. After releasing the button, a
green LED starts flashing.
When the factory adjustments are in use, the green LED flashes
twice. When the user adjustments are in use, the green LED
flashes three times.
Now you can change the factory adjustments to user adjustments
or vice versa by pressing the left button.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Using Analog Output Test Mode
To activate the test mode, press and hold down the right button
while switching on the barometer.
The function forces the voltage or frequency output to 50% of
the scale. As an indication of the test mode, the red LED is lit.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.
Offset Correction
To activate the offset correction mode, press and hold down both
buttons switching on the barometer.
The green and red LEDs are lit. Now you can adjust the offset
correction upwards or downwards.
 Each time when pressing the left button, the offset
goes down by one step (5 Pa), and the green LED
flashes once.
 Each time when pressing the right button, the offset
goes up by one step (5 Pa), and the red LED flashes
once.
Return to the normal operating mode by switching the power off
and on in sequence.


BaroVue Maintenance

Troubleshooting
Symptom: Pressure and temperature values are returned as NAN.
l Check that the sensor card is inserted fully in its socket and in the correct orientation (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Verify that the white wire is connected to the terminal specified by the
SDI12Recorder() instruction.
l Verify that the red wire is connected to a 12V terminal and that the black wire is connected
to the G terminal.
l Use a digital voltage meter to check the voltage to the sensor. If a switched 12V terminal is
used, temporarily connect the red wire to a non-switched 12V terminal for test purposes.
l Verify that the BaroVUE 10 SDI-12 address matches the address entered for the
SDI12Recorder() instruction. The default address is 0. The address can be verified or
changed with the commands described in SDI-12 command basics (p. 32) or by using the
Device Configuration Utility (p. 21).

Maintenance
Required maintenance includes regularly changing the desiccant and recalibrating the sensor
card. When the Enclosure Accessory Humidity Indicator Card changes from blue to pink, replace
the desiccant in the enclosure and, if applicable, the desiccant chamber.
The BaroVUE 10 calculates information about the quality of the measurement (see Quality metric
[p. 19]). The quality metric gives information about the reliability of the data; a poor quality metric
may mean the data is unreliable, and the device should be sent to the factory for calibration.
However, it is recommended that the sensor card be sent to Campbell Scientific for calibration


Sensor card replacement procedure
CAUTION:
The BaroVUE 10 is sensitive to static when the main case is opened. To avoid damage, take
adequate anti-static measures when handling.
1. 2. Contact Campbell Scientific for your replacement sensor card. When received, take this
newly calibrated card with you to the site of the BaroVUE 10 installation.
Open the main case by unclipping the latch and opening the main door. See Figure 8-1 (p.
21).
l Sensor card plugs into the silver card socket mounted on the motherboard (see
Figure 9-1 [p. 29]).
l Correct sensor-card orientation is with card notch facing down (towards the
motherboard). The card revision number should be visible.
CAUTION:
the slot.
If the sensor card is oriented incorrectly, it will not insert fully. Do not force the card into
To remove the sensor card, push the card down towards the socket then release. Spring
tension pushes the sensor card out of the socket.
NOTE:
The sensor card can be safely removed while the BaroVUE 10 is connected to power.
Store the old sensor card in an electrostatic protective package and return it to Campbell
Scientific for recalibration or general servicing.
Unpack the replacement sensor card, avoiding static discharges to the element by touching
the package before touching the element.
Carefully align and insert the sensor card in the card socket on the motherboard.
Confirm the correct orientation and gently push the sensor card into the socket until it
clicks into place.
Before closing the main case, double-check that the card is inserted in the correct
orientation. Refer to Figure 8-1 (p. 21).
Close the main case and secure it by pressing down on the latch and clipping it into
position
